title: Snoop Dogg steps out with family for The Addams Family premiere in LA after tragic death of grandson
text:
Snoop Dogg is rallying around his family amid a tough time.

The 47-year-old rapper, who tragically lost his grandson Kai Love last month, was snapped with his family in Los Angeles at Westfield Century City Sunday for the premiere of his latest project, The Addams Family.

The Long Beach, California native, who voices It in the animated comedy, donned a blue T-shirt with indigo blue leather pants and black suede shoes. He had his hair braided and wore a silver medallion necklace with Gucci Bee sunglasses.

Brave face: Snoop Dogg, 47, was snapped with his family in LA at Westfield Century City Sunday for the premiere of his latest project, The Addams Family

The 6ft4 Drop It Like It's Hot artist at the debut also posed with his co-stars in the new film including Charlize Theron, Chloe Grace Moretz, Finn Wolfhard and Nick Kroll.

The veteran entertainer, whose full name is Calvin Cordozar Broadus Jr, put on a brave face amid the difficult time.

His son Corde Broadus took to Instagram last month to share the heartbreaking news of the infant's passing.

He wrote: 'Kai Love 9/15/19 – 9/25/19 ///// My Son Kai brought so much love and positivity into this world ... his energy will live on and these 10 days of love will always be special to us. Let’s all cherish life and those we love while we are here. Thank you.'

Unity: Snoop, who tragically lost his grandson Kai Love last month, was snapped with his family at the screening

Entertainers: The film's (L-R) Finn Wolfhard, Nick Kroll, Charlize Theron, Chloe Grace Moretz and Snoop posed for a shot

Inimitable: The Long Beach, California native voices It in the animated comedy

Snoop has not publicly spoken on the tragedy, and the family has not revealed the cause of death.

The new animated film is the latest high-profile project spawned from the Charles Addams cartoon series, which also included the 1964-1966 live-action TV show that starred John Astin; and the live-action films The Addams Family in 1991, and Addams Family Values in 1993, that starred Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia and Christopher Lloyd.

Other notable names to lend their voices to the newest installment in the long-running franchise include Oscar Isaac as Gomez Addams, in addition to entertainment icons Bette Midler and Martin Short, and Once Upon a Time In Hollywood standout Mikey Madison.

The Addams Family hits theaters October 11.
